story:
SHARP AS A TACK IS PLAY WITH PURPOSE

Kids learn best through Play. Better yet, kids are most engaged in their own learning experiences through Play. Through our student, educator and community programs, Sharp As A Tack has become the leader in play-based learning.

 

We are using fun and the Power of Play to develop tomorrow’s great thinkers, problem-solvers, communicators and leaders.

Leading that charge has been The Play With Purpose Conference.

WHY THE PLAY WITH PURPOSE NETWORK

Quite frankly, because we are being asked to and Sharp As A Tack is uniquely positioned to do so.

With The Play With Purpose Conference, we wanted to change the culture of professional development, to inspire teachers to use screen-free game play within their curriculum, to create a platform for curriculum development and to make these resources available to teachers throughout the country.

The response to that vision has been truly remarkable! We knew our attendees were going to have a great time and be thrilled receiving free games for their classrooms. From their feedback, however, it is having play-based learning resources available to them through collaboration with Sharp As A Tack and others across the country that has them most excited!

So the question became how do we build a collaborative network that will allow us to develop and deliver these resources to our attendees and others in an efficient, user-friendly, intuitive manner?

In search of a solution, we met with Facebook, Twitter, Google, Amazon, Edmodo, Yelp, Magento and others. However, we learned that a single tool does not yet exist that will allow us to accomplish what is being asked of us, so... we created our own solution - The Play With Purpose Network!

 


WHAT IS THE PLAY WITH PURPOSE NETWORK

The Play With Purpose Network will be the first-of-its-kind social network exclusively for:

  • K-12 educators
  • Home School Educators
  • Parents of Special Need & Gifted Students
  • Occupational Therapists
  • Physical Therapists
  • Speech Pathologists
  • Caregivers of Alzheimer's, Dementia, Stroke and Traumatic Brain Injury Patients

Among other things, The Play With Purpose Network will allow users to:

  • search/browse/download play-based lesson plans and creative lesson ideas
  • create, collaborate, discuss and share play-based lesson plans, teaching tips including modifications and adaptations for various student segments and purposes
  • create interest groups for more relevant collaboration and support (Group examples: Games to Enhance Elementary Math Skills; Literacy Through Screen-Free Games; Second Grade Teachers, etc.)
  • create surveys to get feedback
  • post notes, pictures and videos
  • browse top educational news stories
  • create blogs
  • create and promote events, conferences and workshops
  • seamlessly share content with Facebook
  • share any site, picture, article or page from anywhere on the web with the PWPN Bookmarklet directly from the browser's toolbar with one click
  • chat with colleagues online

Also the following, which allows us to realize several long-term goals:

  • buy games through an integrated online store with links to related documents (lesson plans, teaching tips, Common Core, pictures, videos, etc.)
  • attend online professional development workshops
  • become Sharp As A Tack certified to run play-based enrichment programs

 

That’s right, we are FINALLY going to be selling games!



AND THIS IS JUST THE BEGINNING!

For example, we have a vision of students from around the world collaborating online to design games through our Young Inventors Workshop. These online workshops would give students access to business mentors, industry experts in design, manufacturing and marketing, professional and peer support, etc. Imagine students from Haiti, Zambia, New Zealand, Iraq and New York collaborating on the next hot game! The scope of such a learning opportunity would be immense and help those students to develop the skills to become tomorrow’s leaders.

 

Perhaps the most exciting part for me personally, is that we will use The Play With Purpose Network revenue to help us bring Play With Purpose to under-served students and communities throughout the world at no cost via The Play With Purpose Foundation. Obviously that is a little down the road, but it is very exciting to think about the possibilities!


HOW WILL THESE FUNDS BE SPENT

With your help, we will create one of the world's most innovative and, we believe, most significant social networks – The Play With Purpose Network!

The funds from a successful Indiegogo campaign will allow us to:

  • build collaboration tools
  • build document sharing function 
  • build social share tools 
  • build site databases
  • build advertising portal 
  • design user interface 
  • build/design online store 
  • develop online PD workshops 
  • create online certification program 
  • secure scalable server options
     

PERKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT

Your pledge to The Play With Purpose Network says that you believe in The Power of Play, that you support the tireless efforts of teachers and understand they play a crucial role in the welfare of our society.

We have created some great rewards that will bring The Power of Play to you, your friends, your family and your community. Many of these rewards include the games that are transforming classrooms across the country.

In addition, we wanted to come up with something creative, something unique, something we hope will catch fire and something to honor teachers!

While we hope you consider a larger pledge, we would like to ask you to make a pledge of at least $1 in honor of a teacher that has made an impact on your life and helped you become the person you are today. Once you have made your pledge, we want you to post it on Facebook and/or Twitter for all the world to see! 

 

In the next 30 days, we want to see the social media world explode with pledges/posts honoring teachers everywhere!

What a great way to thank those educators who have impacted our lives, while supporting a project that will give them valuable resources.

Thank you for supporting The Play With Purpose Network! With your help we can bring play-based learning and therapy to millions!

Please see our pledge options below.


OTHER WAYS TO MAKE AN IMPACT

Don't have $1 to spare? We certainly understand, BUT you can still have a tremendous impact on this campaign! 

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Like & Share us on facebook and your other social networks, tweet about us, forward our campaign on to all of your friends and we can get the campaign in front of thousands more people! 


LEADING THE PLAY WITH PURPOSE MOVEMENT

Jason Pine is using the Power of Play to develop tomorrow’s great thinkers, problem-solvers, communicators and leaders. Jason is the Founder/President of Sharp As A Tack and the creator of The Play With Purpose Conference. He has over 25 years of educational experience, including classroom experience as a teacher in Chicago Public Schools, 20+ years experience in after-school programming and extensive experience in curriculum development.

Please see Campaign Perks on the right!

Perk Videos:

  • JuJu says Please Pledge - well, she was supposed to!
  • $50 Bananagrams Perk Video staring JuJu
  • $50 Out of the Box Perk Video
  • $50 Endless Games Perk Video
  • $50 Educational Insights Perk Video staring Mary Jo Reutter

Perk Notes:

  • All contributions of $30 or more made via PayPal will be entered to win a Life-Size Word on the Street Game from Out of the Box Games!!!
    Click here to see it in action
  • All contributions of $10 or more will be entered to win a Human-Size Chess King Board from Cleverhouse Games & Toys. Click here for more information.

story:
Overview

migMobile – is a cross-platform framework that allows you to build fast and fluid native mobile applications in the language of your choice. We provide a common standardized API across the different platforms/operating systems. The application developed on one can be quickly and easily transferred to the others. In real world applications we have realized on average a 70% reduction in development time required to transfer to subsequent platforms.

This enables a developer to choose his favorite environment and develop the application using migMobile in the language that is most comfortable. The transfer of the application maintains all designs, views, layouts, controls, class structure and API calls to the new platform. The other language-specific logic can be transferred manually or by using the migMobile translator (currently in development).

Funding Goals

Version 1.0 of migMobile is a good beginning, it truly makes a substantial impact on the development time required to create full featured, fast and flowing native mobile applications... even on a single platform as was demonstrated in our video, and with an average of 70% savings when migrating an application across to other platforms.. it delivers great value... but we want to do so much more!

We want to expand the control suite, Develop IDE plug-ins to improve the migration process, create common project structures and import / export functions, expand our standardised API and features set, such as introducing common wait handles for synchronised multi threading and of course our big goal, work on improving the 70% platform migration savings to be 100% with our first step being the development of a code translation utility.

But, that is the future... what we want to do at this moment, is tell you more about what you will receive right now in version 1.0...

How it works

Features

Common cross-platform API

migMobile is written in 3 languages: Objective-C (iOS) , Java (Android) and C# (Windows Phone). On every platform the framework provides the exact same API for developers. The only difference is language.

migMobile currently contains following features:

  • Media
  • Multithreading
  • Storage management
  • Social integration
  • UI
  • Application lifecycle
  • JSON and SOAP functions
  • Rich controls suite
  • Sensors
  • System integration
  • Navigation and app state management
  • Common types and definitions
  • Streams
  • Error handling
  • Animations

We have provided additional details on a selection of these features below.

Rich controls suite

migMobile provides a great suite of UI controls. Here are some of them:

The image above is only a sample. The full suite includes all commonly used controls and less common complex composite controls such as an interactive 2D menu. Our control suite includes 20 different controls and more will be included on a regular basis.

Multi-threading support

The framework is written in a way to fully support multi-threading. You can create, start and interact between threads to ensure that the UI remains responsive at all times.

JSON & SOAP tools

Use the tools to automatically generate classes from WSDLs, which allows developers to interact with the web service in an object-oriented manner. We support SOAP as well as JSON services.

Social integration

Social is an increasingly important for mobile applications and our framework provides rich sharing support and integration with the common social networks, e.g. Facebook

Storage API

In modern feature rich applications it is very important that application data can be persisted on a mobile device. On different platforms storage mechanisms are achieved in different ways. Using migMobile allows a developer to access the various native storage APIs in a common and consistent way.

Application lifecycle

migMobile provides a series of event hooks relating to the application and views lifecycle such as:

  • OnCreated
  • OnClosing
  • OnActivated
  • OnDeactivated
  • OnNavigatedTo
  • OnNavigatedFrom
  • OnNavigatingFrom
  • Etc.

 

Layout System

migMobile provides a common and consistent layout system, for instance, relative panels.

In some cases relative positioning is interpreted differently on iOS and Android. However, when a developer uses migMobile, they know that when they position a control, it will be positioned correctly across all platforms.

Relative panel usage example

Every control placed on the relative panel has layout parameters. These specify the control’s alignment and margins.  On the images bellow you can see examples of relative layout:

Sample of UI controls

We provide a demo application for iOS and Android platforms:

The Team

We are a Swiss based software development company that specializes in web and mobile applications. We have been involved in the development of many complex and critical systems. Spanning many years of experience working in Ireland, United Kingdom and Switzerland in some of the largest corporations including Citigroup, UBS and British Telecom. 

We currently have 9 developers working on various web and mobile projects for a variety of blue chip clients.

Our experience in developing applications for a wide range of purposes, for many different clients has taught us that many of the existing products on the market today are becoming inefficient, both in runtime performance and an ever increasing development lifecycle.

migMobile is an example of a product designed to address these performance and complexity issues. It has been in development for 12 months and includes lessons learnt in real world scenarios. V 1.0 of the product that is available and ready today is a result of an optimization process that we began when required to provide multiple versions of a single application for the different platforms. migMobile has demonstrated its ability to provide real and tangible benefits in the creation of mobile applications for our clients and now we want to share these benefits with you.

Migon is an acronym for “Make It GO Now”. This is very much our philosophy and this is reflected in migMobile.

Timelines and what your pledges will go towards

migMobile v 1.0 is ready and available now. This development has already been completed. Any backer that has pledged for a license for our software will receive this software within 14 days of this funding pitch being completed.

Any funds generated will go towards the development of future versions and new functionality, with our main goal being the creation of a code translator.

Version 2.0 wish list:

  • Extend multithreading support (implement wait handles, etc.).
  • Extend social integration API to include additional such as LinkedIn.
  • Initial graphics API for 3D support.
  • Extend the control suite including states support and other RAD enhancements.
  • Add Windows 8 (RT, x86) and BlackBerry (v. 10) support (Windows Phone 8 is already supported in version 1.0).

story: My sister, Nicolle Swanson, passed away unexpectedly on August 7, 2012 at the age of 44 .  She left behind an 11-year-old daughter, Abby. Abby has Asperger's Syndrome. Nicolle had been dedicated to helping her daughter receive the education and support she needs to be successful. Abby has been enrolled in a wonderful school district since kindergarten that provides her with the special education she needs. Beyond that, they provide her with the tools to emotionally cope with everyday stresses, counseling, and more.  My sister and Abby's father were divorced and her father lives 15 miles away.  Jim now has to find a residence within Abby's school district in order for her to continue with her education and receive the support she needs, which has helped her tremendously.  Due to my sister's death and the fact that school starts in 3 weeks, we are asking for donations to help Jim with mounting expenses which include moving, medical costs, school supplies, clothing and a housing deposit (Jim is losing the deposit on his current residence since he is terminating his lease early).  If we exceed our goal, the remaining money will be put into a college fund for her. Please help us carry on what was so important to Nicolle....her daughter's education. We would like to thank you so much for your donation!     :)

story:
This is not a typical camping trip, this is a wilderness adventure.  With your help, students from the Joseph Lee School in Dorchester (this is a Boston Public School) will learn wilderness survival skills, climb bare rock faces, paddle wooden canoes, be responsible for daily farm chores like feeding and walking animals, retrieve eggs from chickens, chop wood, cook on open fires and much more!


This camping trip is not just an adventure.  It is often a life-changing experience. Teachers guide students in exploring their inner selves, examining cultural values and discovering different ways of life.

 

Kroka Expeditions (the wilderness school we will be attending) has already agreed to lower the cost of the trip to the bare minimum.  However, we are still unable to afford the $200 per student cost of the trip. 


When donating, please keep in mind that $200 will allow one student to attend.  However, any amount will be greatly appreciated.  Even a small donation of $10 will make a big difference. 

 

Check out the pictures of last year's trip on the next page! 

 

We thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Internet access is becoming more and more important across the globe. Access to information, and the ability to exchange information, is an important element of human needs and development. This importance is also reflected in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, Article 19: "Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression; this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers."

Tor - Anonymity Online

The goal of Tor is to provide a censorship-resistant & safer access to the Internet. It is the most widely used free & open source anonymization technique in existence. It also makes it possible to host services like websites in a secure and anonymous fashion.

Tor relies on volunteers to share bandwidth and Internet access with other Tor users.

Tor provides the free and open source Tor Browser, a browser specifially made for anonymous and secure web surfing with censorship circumvention built in. At the time of writing, it is being used by more than 500,000 people daily, of which at least 25,000 use "Tor bridges" because their country blocks traditional access to the Tor network. Users include human rights activists, government officials, police investigators, journalists, non-profits and private individuals. 

Torservers.net

Torservers.net was started in 2011 in Germany, and quickly became the largest contributor of exit bandwidth for the Tor network. Today, Torservers.net is a collaborative effort by six+ registered non-profits around the globe (see below for a list of organizations). With selected datacenter partners, we professionally operate Tor infrastructure that strengthens the anonymity and speeds up Tor for everyone.

Together, we currently contribute around 10 Gbit/s, a massive amount of traffic: Over 3000 terabytes of user traffic are moved per month.

All of us volunteer to maintain the infrastructure. Your donations will be used in full to pay for traffic and servers.

What we will use your donations for:

  • run more Tor servers, maintain current ones, increase its speed!

Usability studies conclude that the most common reason to pick an inferiour and potentially unsafe anti-censorship tool is the slow speed of the Tor network. We believe it is crucial to add both a large number of Tor bridges, and a certain number of fast exit relays, as both bridges and exits currently present the bottleneck of the Tor network.

Bridge Operation: To be able to access the Tor network and thus the free Internet, users in oppressive countries that filter standard Tor access need to learn about special Tor relays as entry points, so called Tor bridges. These are not published as a whole, but distributed in small batches via various means (email, web, social networks, etc). Once the censor learns about the specific bridge, the user needs a new one. Blocked bridges can still be useful in other censoring countries, and so far most countries lifted the block after some period of time (most likely to avoid having too large filter rule tables).

Exit Operation: We will equally coordinate operation of high bandwidth Tor exit relays with a different subset of our partners.

How do we distribute the money? 

Each of our partners will get an equal share of the money. Organizations can decide to give parts of their own share to others within the Torservers network. Expenses will be published for public review (hosting bills).

Will the campaign continue after you hit the 1000€ funding goal?

Yes. The campaign will run the full 60 days, and we really hope to collect more than the low barrier of 1000 Euro. To give you an idea, a dedicated Gbit/s server costs at least 400 Euro in Germany, 1000 Euro in Denmark, and 8000 Euro in Asia -- per month. To stengthen the anonymity of Tor users, the servers ideally are distributed all around the globe. Currently, there's a 30 percent chance that a Tor user exits in the USA, and around 25 percent of entering the Tor network via a server in Germany. We aim to change that, and not put more servers into these two jurisdictions.

Torservers.net Organizations

  • Zwiebelfreunde e.V. in Germany founded Torservers.net and oversees the distribution of donations
  • DFRI in Sweden
  • Nos Oignons in France
  • Swiss Privacy Foundation in Switzerland
  • Frënn vun der Ënn in Luxembourg
  • NoiseTor in the USA

Each of our partners was hand-picked and is trusted. Additional Torservers organizations are currently being formed in the Netherlands and Denmark.

 

The video was created by Tactical Tech to promote the Tor network. Thanks! 

Stickers and posters are sponsored by Stickma. If you have any printing jobs, you should do it via these guys. They are simply awesome.

Perks

Tor Poster

Official Torproject Stickers

Alternative Tor Stickers

Tiny Tor Stickers

Tiny Tor Sticker used to cover laptop camera

 

torservers.net is not affiliated with the Tor project. "Tor" and the "Onion Logo" are registered trademarks of The Tor Project, Inc.

Questions?

You can find us on IRC, irc.oftc.net in channel #torservers. Or drop us an email at support@torservers.net. You can also contact Moritz on Jabber at moritz /at/ torservers.net.
story_txt:
Internet access is becoming more and more important across the globe. Access to information, and the ability to exchange information, is an important element of human needs and development. This importance is also reflected in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, Article 19: "Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression; this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers."
Tor - Anonymity Online
The goal of Tor is to provide a censorship-resistant & safer access to the Internet. It is the most widely used free & open source anonymization technique in existence. It also makes it possible to host services like websites in a secure and anonymous fashion.
Tor relies on volunteers to share bandwidth and Internet access with other Tor users.
Tor provides the free and open source Tor Browser, a browser specifially made for anonymous and secure web surfing with censorship circumvention built in. At the time of writing, it is being used by more than 500,000 people daily, of which at least 25,000 use "Tor bridges" because their country blocks traditional access to the Tor network. Users include human rights activists, government officials, police investigators, journalists, non-profits and private individuals. 
Torservers.net
Torservers.net was started in 2011 in Germany, and quickly became the largest contributor of exit bandwidth for the Tor network. Today, Torservers.net is a collaborative effort by six+ registered non-profits around the globe (see below for a list of organizations). With selected datacenter partners, we professionally operate Tor infrastructure that strengthens the anonymity and speeds up Tor for everyone.
Together, we currently contribute around 10 Gbit/s, a massive amount of traffic: Over 3000 terabytes of user traffic are moved per month.
All of us volunteer to maintain the infrastructure. Your donations will be used in full to pay for traffic and servers.
What we will use your donations for:

run more Tor servers, maintain current ones, increase its speed!
Usability studies conclude that the most common reason to pick an inferiour and potentially unsafe anti-censorship tool is the slow speed of the Tor network. We believe it is crucial to add both a large number of Tor bridges, and a certain number of fast exit relays, as both bridges and exits currently present the bottleneck of the Tor network.

These are not published as a whole, but distributed in small batches via various means (email, web, social networks, etc). Once the censor learns about the specific bridge, the user needs a new one. Each of our partners will get an equal share of the money. Organizations can decide to give parts of their own share to others within the Torservers network. Expenses will be published for public review (hosting bills).

Yes. The campaign will run the full 60 days, and we really hope to collect more than the low barrier of 1000 Euro. To give you an idea, a dedicated Gbit/s server costs at least 400 Euro in Germany, 1000 Euro in Denmark, and 8000 Euro in Asia -- per month. Currently, there's a 30 percent chance that a Tor user exits in the USA, and around 25 percent of entering the Tor network via a server in Germany. We aim to change that, and not put more servers into these two jurisdictions.

story:
What's this Campaign About?

Long Story Short:

You may say that there are bigger problems in the world, and that might be true. However, this plan is very cost effective and quick to implement Step by step.For the first class we first need a roof for the school class room meant for the computer class for ages 5-18 (app value =  4,000 euro to  5,000 euro) As we have been told by the school board member we are in contact with. Additionally to building the roof, we are naturally aiming at also contributing a small startup packkage of computers to see to it the kids can get to work wright after the roof has been completed, for this an additional 3000  euromaking the total 8000 euro we ask here would be a welcome donation.

  • But besides that the walls need connecting cables installed for the computers that is what additional amount added to this campaign is for.
  • *There is no bureaucracy involved and no red tape
    *The first term of this campaign closes Nov. 2013
    *I will schip all needed materials ahead and join the school immediately to start proceedings & building the roof. Dec 2013 End jan.2014
    *The materials arrive in Ghana at the end of Jan. or mid Feb.
    *By mid to late march If the finances  meet all the needs the roof will be completed in the school and the students have access to the first computers for the class.

The Twedaase primary school build in tema commissioned 1957  is the  first build primary school in tema and to us this is not just about one school ist is also about sending a message. Cause as the entire world keeps globalising in a pace faster then anybody estimated when computers started taking over the planet.

But in this development Africa has not been on the same pace. And we want to send a message with this that they can be, starting in the educational system not only for schools of kids with money, like private schools but also public schools thru programs like this where every little bit you give makes a huge impact of the lifes of entire families. Cause what those kids learn they also can pass on to parents or siblings that don't have the opportunity we are trying to provide for them yet.

Cosmopolitan Future

For all other info on us behind founding this project visit: cosmopolitanfuture.com

You can also help us more by spreading the awareness of this initiative to everybody you know. Your contribution financially means a great deal to us, but in spreading the word more people will become aware of this project and see it's importance. As a gift for your contribution in time or money starting end august 2013 you can download a free track created to also spread awarenes on the concept of " cosmopolitan future" on the artist website missalpha.com.

story:
Our History

As Heritage celebrates over 40 years of service in the Hagerstown area, we rejoice in the work the Lord has done and will continue to do in the lives of all who are a part of our school community.

Our mission statement explains our purpose: we are participants in equipping our students in all grades academically, spiritually, socially, physically so they may discern and live out God's plan for their lives.

Heritage Academy began in 1969 and is a private, interracial, nonprofit, independent, Biblical Christian school. It offers spiritual and academic standards to families in the tri-state area. The primary objectives and purposes of the school are to train the student in the knowledge of God and the Christian way of life and to give the best education in all subject areas.

Our Needs

As stated above Heritage Academy was founded in 1969 and we are still using many of the same facilities. The school is in need of some major upgrades and improvement. With these funds we would like to be able to improve the facilities here at Heritage Academy so that we can continue doing what God has called for us to do. Would you please consider helping us reach our goal to make our school a better place for our students?

story:
Dear friends, family and Isaack supporters,

We would like to thank everyone again for the wonderful support we received last year towards Isaack's education at St. Andrew's College. 

We felt it was time to update everyone on Isaack's journey over the last year. Isaack had a fantastic year at St. Andrew's College. He played soccer in the fall and ran track and field in the spring and finished the year by winning the Colonel Tiltson award, 'a courage under fire award' for the student who was deemed by their teachers to have put in the most effort into education and other school activities. We would have liked for Isaack to have stayed at SAC and they did offer a larger scholarship for him to enter grade 10, but his Canadian visa was unfortunately not renewed when we made the application (and to complicate matters the visa workers have been on strike for almost a year). Because of the Canadian immigration rules and to not impact on Isaack's ability to reapply and return to Canada at a later date we had him return to Tanzania in September 2013. After Isaack's return to Tanzania, we started to look for good educational opportunities for him there so he can complete high school. Thankfully a boarding school in Arusha has taken an interest in him largely due to strong references from previous teachers. Isaack has been offered a spot at St. Constantine's School where they take several orphan students per year, who, like Isaack, have good potential and great personalities but would not have the opportunity to go to private school in Tanzania. The school has also realized Isaack's potential for sports leadership and he will take on a role as assistant to the Director of the sports programs at the school when he is not in the classroom. We are so grateful that St. Constantine's is giving Isaack this chance. They are providing Isaack with some support towards his tuition and they have asked us to raise $5000 towards living expenses, school uniform and health fees. Our goal is to raise a bit more because Indiegogo keeps 4% and if we raise over our target it will go towards school fees for next year.

Hence, we are reaching out to you again to ask for support for Isaack in his new school. We thank all of you from the bottom of our hearts for supporting Isaack last year in what proved to be an extremely educational and fulfilling year for him at St. Andrew's. It is our goal to keep Isaack supported so that he can complete his secondary school education in Tanzania over the next two years. We know he will make all of us proud no matter what challenges he faces. We will be updating Isaack's Soccer Dream fundraising campaign on Indiegogo over the next few days and we hope that, if you are able, you or your family members will be able to contribute something (however small) towards Isaack's education.

story:
FLOOD VICTIMS NEED YOUR HELP

Heavy rains and flooding have killed 111 people and left another 129 injured across Pakistan, according to figures released by National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) on Monday. 

Floods have damaged 5,427 houses and 325,000 acres of ready crops.It said that as many as 1097 villages have been ruined by the flash floods caused by heavy downpours. Overall 399,034 people in Pakistan were affected by the recent floods.

Read News Reports: BBC , CNN


What the Victims Need Urgently

Flood victims need following items urgently:

  • Food and clean drinking water.
  • Clothes, Sanitary pads, Medicines. 
  • Tents, stoves and emergency lights. 

Make Difference & Get Involved 

By contributing to this campaign, you will make a big difference for the victims and their families. Because of your contribution these victims will be able to get food, clean water and clothes. You are not just contributing to a great cause, you are also showing your love and compassion for the humanity regardless of any differences. 

I have created Perks for this campaign based on current requirements of the victims, higher level contributors will receive exclusive photos from the affected areas showing how their contributions has made impact. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help. You can do following to help:

  • Ask your friends to donate to this campaign.
  • Send your old clothes to us. 
  • Send your old emergency lights or anything else that may help. 
  • Send your old mobile phones, it will help us setup a small network of local informers who would use them to ask for help or food or medicines.

story:
My Story

My name is Cat.  Short, simple, a little playful.  It suits me.  I used to be a graphic designer but even at 24 I could tell that it wasn't where my passion was.  I've always been in love with the theatre and my thoughts continually returned there.  I finally made the decision to go back to school at the University of Michigan to study theatre design (specifically, costumes) as a way to blend my design background and passion for theatre.  So far it's been going great but financial truths are starting to catch up to me.

Enter the opportunity I've always dreamt of.  The University of Michigan offers a study abroad program to London through the theatre department.  The trip includes backstage tours of theatres such as the Globe as well as trips to see live theatre in London.  It has been on my bucket list since I was 14 to go to England and now I have the opportunity to do that while also learning so much about theatre history, costume history, and the art and architecture of the city.  Not to mention my obsession with cultures other than my own- this trip is a dream come true.


There is just one little problem. 

The ticket price.  The overall price of the trip is going to cost me around $5,500.  I was awarded a scholarship of $1,500 and I  have $2,500 saved.  That still leaves me wanting for another 1,500.  I am only asking for help with my tuition charges for the class which total $1,138


Here is the catch:

I have to make my final decision by February 24, 2011 when the program fee is due.  I can't express how much this trip means to me and I am facing giving up on it entirely, please help me pay the tuition for this trip.

Every dollar I raise will go toward my education, you have my promise on that.  If I am blessed enough to raise more than the $1,138 in tuition I will apply whatever is above toward my final year of school.  If I do not raise enough money to study abroad whatever money I make I will still put toward my tuition for the 2011/2012 school year, my last on a long journey!

story:
Scarlett Diaz

  • I am a student filmmaker in the bay area, attending SFAI.
  • I want to make documentary films to raise awareness of other cultures and their struggles around the world.
  • I am very loving and caring; I wish to leave an impact solely to help others in need.

The Break Down

  • I will need around 3,000 to be able to volunteer in Katmandu, Nepal
  • 2,100 is solely for the flight; it is a long and very pricey flight.
  • 500 goes towards the organization I will be working with, RCDNEPAL. (This covers meals, home for 4 weeks, and insurance.
  • 259 goes towards the registration fee for RCDNEPAL
  • The rest of the money goes towards the fees of Indiegogo

The Impact

  • My goal, above all, is to help and care for the children in Nepal. I think it is extremely important to show children in need around the world that they are not forgotten, and most importantly, that they are deeply loved.
  • I will make a short film of my experience, which I hope will motivate other kids my age to engage in volunteer programs, local, or abroad.
  • It is going to be a learning experience for myself as well, and I know I will grow as an individual throughout my stay for 4 weeks.
  • It is amazing how volunteer organizations like this exist, but do not get as much attention as more expensive ones because they do not have the money for advertisemnents or web design. I hope my film can help the organization itself to recruit more volunteers.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word around! Share this link on FB or on Twitter
  • Do you want to be part of the experience, or know someone who does? E-mail me!
  • Donating, even just a dollar, helps more than you think !

story:
Hello Indiegogo!

Did you know...

  • Over 97% of businesses in America have fewer than 100 employees and 
  • Small businesses employ over half of the private workforce in America?

Entrepreneurship is HUGE!

We have created this indiegogo campaign as a teaching tool for entrepreneurship education.  This 30 day campaign provides a personal example for teachers and students to explore crowdfunding and small business creation.  

Proceeds from this campaign will help pay for the collection of data, writing and editing.  

When the campaign is over, the creators will write a short case that will be available for FREE.  The case will describe the process of creating, promoting, and adapting the campaign over time.  As entrepreneurship educators, we haven't found any cases that cover this type of material.  And we welcome information from other crowdfunders.  If it is successful and useful, we will continue to write additional cases for use at the university, high school and middle school levels. 

 

What do we offer you?

MADE IN AMERICA

ORGANIC  

FUN APPAREL   


We are launching a line of fun, organic cotton hats, t-shirts, and sweatshirts that celebrates the wackiness of entrepreneurship everywhere. 

As entrepreneurs and employees in Silicon Valley, we work and, like many of you, don’t play. Every day we would joke about sayings and products, but we didn't do anything... until now.

Here we share our craziness with you.

Yes, there are many, many shirt makers out there. In fact, we have enjoyed and been inspired by many of the indiegogo projects. This project builds on this legacy of witty and eco-conscious designers. 

Our first line – shown here in white – is comprised of four designs to tickle your funny bone. All products are made with high quality organic cotton. The shirts are all made in the USA.  Our line uses black, white, and dark green apparel with contrasting text.

We are also producing a limited number of indiegogo editions in black with indiegogo text colors. We hope that it brings a smile to your face. 

Thank you for checking out our project. 

 
JJ and J 
Co-founders 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for funding to get this line of apparel off the ground.
  • This campaign will serve as an example to help educate undergraduate and high school students about crowdfunding and entrepreneurship.  
  • In return, you can get the Only in SV line of apparel first.
  • We are offering many levels of rewards from the original hats to the full limited edition line. There is something for everyone. If you can’t find a reward to your liking, let us know and we will see what we can do.

Choices for this campaign:

*** T and Hoodies

Colors: black, white, and dark green

4 designs

  • CEO
  • I love entrepreneurship
  • Silicon Valley Business Attire
  • CEO ... EIEIO

The default for gifts is a size large in white.

 

*** Hat

Colors: black and dark green

  • CEO

 

Why us?  

Because we have spent over 10 years teaching entrepreneurship.  We love it.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out.

Share this campaign with the world!

This campaign is fun for all of us. 

Support small businesses in your neighborhood.  -
story_txt:
Hello Indiegogo!
Did you know...

Over 97% of businesses in America have fewer than 100 employees and 
Small businesses employ over half of the private workforce in America?

Entrepreneurship is HUGE!
We have created this indiegogo campaign as a teaching tool for entrepreneurship education.  This 30 day campaign provides a personal example for teachers and students to explore crowdfunding and small business creation.  
Proceeds from this campaign will help pay for the collection of data, writing and editing.  
When the campaign is over, the creators will write a short case that will be available for FREE.  The case will describe the process of creating, promoting, and adapting the campaign over time.  As entrepreneurship educators, we haven't found any cases that cover this type of material.  And we welcome information from other crowdfunders.  If it is successful and useful, we will continue to write additional cases for use at the university, high school and middle school levels. 
 
What do we offer you?
MADE IN AMERICA
ORGANIC  
FUN APPAREL   
We are launching a line of fun, organic cotton hats, t-shirts, and sweatshirts that celebrates the wackiness of entrepreneurship everywhere. 
As entrepreneurs and employees in Silicon Valley, we work and, like many of you, don’t play. Every day we would joke about sayings and products, but we didn't do anything... until now.
Here we share our craziness with you.
Yes, there are many, many shirt makers out there. In fact, we have enjoyed and been inspired by many of the indiegogo projects. This project builds on this legacy of witty and eco-conscious designers. 
Our first line – shown here in white – is comprised of four designs to tickle your funny bone. All products are made with high quality organic cotton. The shirts are all made in the USA.  Our line uses black, white, and dark green apparel with contrasting text.
We are also producing a limited number of indiegogo editions in black with indiegogo text colors. We hope that it brings a smile to your face. 
Thank you for checking out our project. 
 

JJ and J Co-founders 



What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for funding to get this line of apparel off the ground.
This campaign will serve as an example to help educate undergraduate and high school students about crowdfunding and entrepreneurship.

story:
Short Summary

We are the ones we have been waiting for! The time is now to shift to a universal humanity in which we recognize and act from our true essence. In Boston, Massachusetts a group of people are producing an incredible event for all of humanity to celebrate the shift and usher in a global culture of peace. Everyone is welcome and the entrance fee is low and/or by donation.

What We Need & What You Get

We need money to help pay for:

  • Space rental
  • Publicity
  • Marketing

Your contribution will directly impact our world culture:

  • Help people shift from ego to essence
  • Raise the vibration of the planet
  • Participate in building a global culture of peace

We have successfully arranged over 100 confirmed presenters, performers, exhibitors and vendors to come together to begin a new era.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please pass the word about Birth 2012 Boston by visiting our website: birth2012bostonn.com
  • Like Consious Evolution Boston on FaceBook
  • Share the event Birth 2012 Boston on FaceBook

story:
We want every girl and woman in Cameroon to be informed of the dangers of breast ironing by the end of 2013. 

This project began in May 2012 and has reached about 10.000 women in the North West Region of Cameroon who have been sensitized about the dangers of breast ironing and the need to give their children sex education. We want to be able to extend it to the other 9 regions of the country and also include screening and treatment of breast related diseases.

With your support we will expand our success and equip women leaders in Cameroon to become sensitizers and train thousands of women to commit to end the practice in their homes and communities.

Many victims of breast ironing regret they were born girls. Their self-esteem and that natural pride of womahood have been destroyed. By contributing to this cause, you are restoring an invaluable teasure in that little girl.You will be teaching her how to rejoice at the birth of a girl child.Above all, you will be helping to preserve the health and spirits of generations of girls to come.

This sum will help:

-Transport sensitizers to remote areas

-Organize training sessions

-Pay for media campaigns,

-Produce and distribute flyers and campaign kits in schools and other community  centers,

- Support the treatment of victims with breast related diseases

-Provide T-shirts,banners and snacks for participants of our nationwide breast ironing awareness march in Februrary,March, July and November 2013.

Please, if you cannot afford to contribute money,kindly share the link to as many people as possible.

story:
Welcome!

We are the League of Extraordinary Poets, a student-run group at the University of Michigan-Dearborn. We are passionate about poetry, creativity, and literacy. We believe that change should start at home, so we are raising money for ReadingWorks, an organization that works to improve literacy right here in Metro Detroit.

We will be holding a dinner at the conclusion of this fundraising campaign! Tickets are available when you make a donation of at least $10 and select a perk. The dinner itself will be held on Thursday, March 27th at 5pm in Fairlane Center North, Quad E. We'll have great food, poetry recitations, a jazz band performance, and more! Paula Brown, Executive Director of ReadingWorks, will be at the dinner to talk about the organization's work to improve literacy.

[The fundraising dinner is funded entirely by the UMD Student Organization Advisory Council and the English Department - all donations to this campaign are transferred directly to the ReadingWorks nonprofit by Indiegogo]

Our Goal

We want to raise funds for ReadingWorks, a non-profit organization working to promote literacy in metro Detroit and surrounding areas.

  • Up to 47% of adults in the City of Detroit are functionally illiterate
  • 42 million Americans cannot read, write, or perform simple math
  • ReadingWorks links literacy agencies in Metro Detroit with each other and with other professional and social services and works to raise awareness of and funds for these programs. They also collect data and measure results to improve literacy programs.
  • Source: http://www.readingworksdetroit.org/

How You Can Help

If you, like us, believe in the importance of improving literacy in our community, here is what you can do to help:

  • Make a donation! If that's not possible, you can still contribute:
  • Share this campaign with your friends and family!
  • Would you like to donate some of your artwork to be used as a donation perk? If so, e-mail us at umdlep@gmail.com

story:
(find English version below...)

QUIENES SOMOS

La Fundación Escuela para la Vida nace en el 2004 y trabajamos con empeño des de entonces educando los niños y jóvenes del corregimiento de Montebello en Cali - Colombia, quienes viven una situación económica muy difícil. Todas las personas merecen tener acceso a una formación escolar con calidad humana para brindarse un futuro exitoso a sí mismos y contribuir a la construcción de una sociedad justa. Ese es nuestro principal objetivo y lo trabajamos a través de la creación del Colegio de las Aguas Montebello.

Andrés Bäppler, arquitecto Colombo – Alemán, decide crear esta Fundación en compañía de algunos habitantes del corregimiento como una respuesta a su preocupación sobre el futuro de sus niños, niñas y jóvenes, quienes tenían grandes probabilidades de estar expuestos a la drogadicción, embarazos precoces y pandillas por las dificultades de acceso a la educación.

Además de servir a los niños, niñas y jóvenes, la Fundación gestiona proyectos en áreas de la salud, la producción limpia y el bienestar social, ambiental, económico, cultural y ocupacional. Madres cabeza de familia también pueden acceder a los proyectos productivos y de emprendimiento.

Voluntarios de todo el mundo han llegado a lo largo de estos años, para colaborar tanto en el proceso educativo como en la propia construcción del Colegio de las Aguas.

El Colegio comenzó hace 10 años con 17 estudiantes matriculados. En este tiempo hemos estado trabajando duro para aumentar la cobertura educativa, hasta hoy que contamos con casi 300 estudiantes. Sin embargo el nivel de escolarización en Montebello sigue siendo muy bajo, sólo el 20% de niños y jóvenes tienen acceso a la educación. Por este motivo queremos seguir creciendo, para poder brindar a muchos más la posibilidad de hacer parte de este proyecto social.

http://www.escuelaparalavida.org/

CONTEXTO

La falta de educación y las dificultades a su acceso son la causa fundamental de los problemas que afectan el corregimiento de Montebello: la infraestructura es insuficiente lo cual genera un alto nivel de desescolarización y analfabetismo; el atraso tecnológico generado por las dificultades económicas y geográficas; la presencia limitada del estado y una baja destinación de recursos; la falta de compromiso y sentido de pertenencia de los docentes; desinterés de las asociaciones de padres de familia; y la poca gestión y liderazgo. Estas dificultades hacen que se amplíe la oferta de educación privada a costos muy altos para la población y que los recursos disponibles en la comunidad no sean efectivos y retrasen el avance de los niños y jóvenes.

La consecuencia de estos factores es que los jóvenes del corregimiento no son competitivos en el mercado laboral y se les dificulta el acceso a la educación superior. La población se ve afectada con sentimientos de baja autoestima, falta de orientación y poco desarrollo sostenible. También la calidad de vida de los habitantes y en particular de los jóvenes se ve afectado dado que el mal uso que hacen de su tiempo libre genera malos hábitos: creación y vinculación a pandillas, consumo de drogas, delincuencia, prostitución y embarazos tempranos, entre otros.

El ámbito cultural también se ve afectado ya que no hay una cohesión en esa población multicultural, el desplazamiento laboral diario hacia la ciudad hace que los valores positivos se pierdan o disminuyan. Por lo tanto se hace necesaria la creación de este tipo de programas y espacios urbanos de encuentro, para representar e integrar internamente a todos los grupos del corregimiento.

Otro factor que afecta a la vida de la población es el desempleo. Por un lado, faltan proyectos productivos, y además se evidencia la falta de mano de obra calificada, así como la carencia de capacitación en las pocas labores que hay. Por esta inseguridad y destrucción del tejido social el nivel de vida de Montebello no puede mejorar y se genera un desplazamiento forzoso, abandonando la poca identidad que hay.

POR QUÉ NECESITAMOS TU COLABORACIÓN

Queremos ayudar a más niños y jóvenes de Montebello a acceder a una educación de calidad. Brindarles las herramientas para convertirse en personas íntegras y bien preparadas para el mercado laboral actual. 

Pero la infrastructura actual del colegio ya no es suficiente para dar cabida a la numerosa demanda, algunos salones están deteriorados y hay carencias de dotación para una enseñanza adecuada. Los profesores tienen demasiados estudiantes por clase y falta personal especializado en diversas áreas.

PARA QUÉ USAREMOS TU DONACIÓN

Queremos construir un nuevo edificio en el Colegio de las Aguas. Esto permitirá un significativo aumento de la cobertura educativa: cerca de 100 niños y jóvenes más tendrán acceso a la escolarización.

Este incluye la creación de una biblioteca, que servirá para reforzar y ampliar aprendizajes. Habrá un espacio de estudio orientado, ampliando así las horas que los chicos permanecen en el colegio y en su proceso educativo.

CÓMO AYUDAR?

Haciendo una donación. No importa cuanto, cualquier cantidad será una ayuda inmensa para la realización de este hermoso proyecto y cientos de niños te lo agradecerán toda su vida.

También te pediremos que difundas esta campaña y nuestro singular proyecto entre todos tus amigos, familia y conocidos potenciales a colaborar en esta causa. Manda nuestro link por mail, comparte esta campaña a través de redes sociales, etc..

Otra opción es venir a Cali y unirte al equipo de voluntarios. Necesitamos manos para seguir construyendo, así como personas que quieran dar clases a los niños. Tus conocimientos y tu tiempo son muy valiosos aquí!


ABOUT US

The “Escuela para la Vida” Foundation (School for Life) was founded in 2004 and we have worked hard in to provide education for the children and young people of the village of Montebello in Cali, Colombia who are faced with a very difficult economic situation.

We strongly believe that everybody deserves equal access to quality education in order to create a successful future and be able to contribute to a just society. This is the primary mission we carry out through the foundation “Colegio de las Aguas” in Montebello.

Andrés Bäppler , a German / Colombian architect, started this foundation with just a few of the town’s residents as a response to the problems facing the local youth such as drug addiction, teenage pregnancy, and everyday violence.

In addition to serving youth, the foundation manages projects in areas of health and occupational development.

Over the years volunteers from around the world have come and assisted by teaching at the school and have worked in the actual construction of the “Colegio de las Aguas”.

The “Colegio de las Aguas” originally began 10 years ago with at the time 17 students. We have since then worked hard to increase this number and today we have 264 students.

Unfortunately though, the level of schooling in Montebello is still very low were only 20 % of children have access to education.

http://www.escuelaparalavida.org/

CONTEXT

Lack of education plays a large part of the problems affecting the village of Montebello: insufficient infrastructure which contributes to a high level of illiteracy and lack of schooling generated by a host of economic and social problems; limited presence of the state, exhausted teachers, lack of parent involvement, and little community leadership.

The lack of publicly funded schools in Montebello makes education inaccessible for most residents as only private options are available. The limited community resources severely hamper the educational prospects of the local children.

The consequence of these factors is that the youth of Montebello are not competitive in the labor market with little prospect of any higher education. The population is affected with feelings of low self-esteem, lack of guidance and unsustainable development.

The overall low quality of life especially affects the young people since the abundant free time generates bad habits: gang involvement, drug use, crime, prostitution and teen pregnancy, to name just a few.

Another major problem is unemployment. The lack of skilled labor is evident as well as the lack of training for the few jobs that do exist

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We want to help more children and young people from Montebello to have access to quality education. To give them the tools to become self-sufficient and well prepared for the current labor market.

It should be clear that the current infrastructure of the school is no longer enough to accommodate the large demand. Some of the classrooms are damaged and lack of resources make it difficult to provide for an adequate education.

The teachers have too many students per class and lack specialized training in some critical areas.

WHAT WE USE YOUR DONATION FOR?

With your help we will build a new building that will not only allow us to significantly increase our ability to provide education to an additional 100 kids but improve the quality of education received as well.

Besides the creation of a library, there will be an after school activity center which will serve to expand the hours that children will actually remain in school.

HELPING?

By making a donation, no matter how small, will be of immense help for the realization of this beautiful project and which will literally help hundreds of children for years to come.

We also ask you to spread this campaign and our unique project among all your friends, family, acquaintances, and potential donors to contribute to this cause. By sending our link by mail, sharing this campaign on Facebook, etc.

You are invited to come to Cali and join the team of other volunteers. We need hands to continue building and people who want to teach our children. Your knowledge and your time is very valuable here!

The lack of skilled labor is evident as well as the lack of training for the few jobs that do existWHY WE NEED YOUR HELPWe want to help more children and young people from Montebello to have access to quality education. To give them the tools to become self-sufficient and well prepared for the current labor market.It should be clear that the current infrastructure of the school is no longer enough to accommodate the large demand. Some of the classrooms are damaged and lack of resources make it difficult to provide for an adequate education.The teachers have too many students per class and lack specialized training in some critical areas.WHAT WE USE YOUR DONATION FOR?With your help we will build a new building that will not only allow us to significantly increase our ability to provide education to an additional 100 kids but improve the quality of education received as well.Besides the creation of a library, there will be an after school activity center which will serve to expand the hours that children will actually remain in school.HELPING?By making a donation, no matter how small, will be of immense help for the realization of this beautiful project and which will literally help hundreds of children for years to come.We also ask you to spread this campaign and our unique project among all your friends, family, acquaintances, and potential donors to contribute to this cause. By sending our link by mail, sharing this campaign on Facebook, etc.You are invited to come to Cali and join the team of other volunteers. We need hands to continue building and people who want to teach our children. Your knowledge and your time is very valuable here!

story:
In our community there is an increasing prevalence of developmental disabilities such as Autism and Aspergers.  Moreover, decreasing state and federal funding for children with special needs has left families searching for appropriate, affordable activities for their children. By providing a safe, nurturing and fun environment in which children and youth with special needs can develop valuable life skills, Hope, Horses and Kids meets this critical need for area families.The progress observed by parents, caregivers and teachers is tremendous. When special needs clients arrive at HHK, most have never interacted with a horse, and many lack confidence, communication and coping skills. The ability of our team to identify and respond to the needs of each group, and perhaps most importantly - the steady, clear and uncomplicated way in which horses connect with clients - provides a powerful opportunity for learning and growth.

Population Served:Hope, Horses and Kids equine learning model serves two core constituencies: Children and young adults ages 7-35, with developmental disabilities such as Cerebral Palsy, Downs’s Syndrome, and those with Autism, Asperger’s and other Pervasive Developmental Delays; and youth, ages 14-21, living in foster care, group homes or involved in the justice system, with social and emotional challenges.

Our Programs: HHK offers three core learning experiences Group Groundwork Lessons, Individual Mounted Lessons and Vocational Training. Each of these activities helps clients gain confidence in their ability to care for, direct and ride the horses and many demonstrate a greater sense of control over their emotions, a better understanding how they communicate and a lasting connection to another being - the horse.

  • Group Groundwork Lessons conducted in partnership with schools and community organizations, introduce special needs individuals to the language of the horse and emphasize the acquisition of life skills. HHK uses horses as instructional partners to build self-confidence, develop independence, encourage responsibility, teach consequences, illustrate cause-and-effect relationships, develop social skills, and recognize non-verbal communication and cues. These essential life skills assist students to navigate the challenges they face in social situations.

  • Individual Mounted Lessons are designed for children with developmental delays and are tailored to the individual needs of each client. HHK utilizes the horse as a tool to help children and youth overcome motor, visual, sensory and anxiety challenges. A typical lesson includes stretching and games to encourage strength, coordination and mobility. Clients also navigate in different patterns throughout the arena. All of these activities encourage active listening and following directions. Children with communication difficulties are encouraged to use words to tell the horse what to do. Following lessons, parents and volunteers have observed numerous instances of improved communication, coordination, balance and expansion of emotional expression.

  • Vocational Training offers at-risk youth the opportunity to acquire valuable vocational and professional skills through participation in four weeks of hands-on training led by Hope, Horses and Kids followed by four weeks of job shadowing at community business partners. The program also includes eight weeks of paid-internships at the business-partner of their choice.

  •  What our Partners Say According to Tyler Steer, Program Manager at Peacock Acres, “Many youth are often too scared or uncomfortable to interact with the horses, and HHK’s ability to convince them to work with the horses is uncanny. But the biggest highlights come when a student who has never touched a horse before develops a working relationship based on respect and communication. The process that our kids go through is amazing and transformative.”

story:
Hello, Folks!

My name is Kyle Pratt - a permie and longtime resident of Western Massachusetts. In March I hope to attend a permaculture teacher training called Designing Educational Ecosystems, which provides participants with tools to better lead and assist permaculture workshops and design certifications. Then, from the knowledge and momentum gained in this training, I will teach a series of accessible, affordable introductory permaculture courses in my area this summer. These workshops will be an excellent opportunity to reach a wider audience and strengthen our community of change-makers, while providing me with invaluable hands-on teaching experience.

So, this is where you come in! By contributing to my campaign, you will not only help fund my attendance at this training, but will also enable me to further propagate permaculture in my community. If you're interested in attending a workshop, then you can think of your contribution as an upfront ticket purchase - much like how farmers sell CSA shares for their future produce, except in this case it would be CSE: Community Supported Education. And even if you're not interested in attending a permaculture workshop - there is still a ton of awesome swag you can receive by donating!


With your Support I Can...

...contribute in a meaningful way to the beneficial impact of the rapidly expanding permaculture community.

…inspire others to become active change-makers in their neighborhoods and communities.

…propagate permaculture to people for whom it may otherwise be inaccessible by offering workshops to small groups in public venues, residences, and businesses. 

…attend the Designing Educational Ecosystems course, which helps participants "clarify, articulate, and evolve their beliefs about what is a teacher and what is their teaching pedagogy," as well as “develop the complete suite of skills needed to begin successfully leading short permaculture workshops and other events on their own.” My hope is to one day develop my teaching enough to be able to assist others in various communities throughout the world, not just my own.

…expand and improve my pedagogical toolset through participation in a formal permaculture teacher training, and learn to push through the edges and perceived restrictions that hem me in as an educator.

...collaborate with other peramculture teachers and mentors to host workshops, PDC's, talks, and more!


Why Permaculture Matters (a lot).

What?

The word "permaculture" takes on many definitions, depending on who you speak to. For many it consists of "meeting human needs while enhancing ecosystem health." Some would opt for the more specific: "a design of human settlements that are based on ecological principles and practices that restore and renew natural systems." And still others could sum up permaculture as "the practice of common sense." Despite the vast and various ways of describing permaculture, most would likely agree that permaculture essentially serves to promote healthy, regenerative growth of our earth, its people, and the balance between them.

Why?

You may not call what you do “permaculture” – it may be green building or sustainable agriculture or non-violent communication or one of the countless other labels attributed to the things we do and believe. What’s important isn't the labels, but the unity that can be found in similar goals and visions. Despite the many grim and often uncertain issues of our current time - global climate change, species extinction, social isolation, etc. - every individual does what they can in their own way to address these realities. Permaculture envisions a world designed for resiliency, where multi-generational communities thrive and cooperation is a premium; where agency to grow food is given back to the people so they can feel empowered and sustained; and where inner human landscapes and outer ecological landscapes can reflect one another in health and harmony. Permaculture – and anything that promotes a similar vision – is needed now in order to start repairing and regenerating our planet and our lives.

How?

Permaculture ethics, principles, and practices are beginning to gain a foothold in many places throughout the world, yet remain inaccessible for most. Costs of running a Permaculture Design Course (PDC) – an internationally recognized certification – are often high, which inflates the cost for the students. Many students may also have difficulty committing the 72+ hours required for a full PDC, which is typically organized in a multi-week intensive format.

This summer I will be teaching a series of smaller permaculture workshops, which will offer cost-effective access to the basics while still providing participants with pragmatic know-how to begin their permaculture journey. Depending on the funding tier, these workshops can also be held in a space of the participant's choosing, thereby producing tangible, place-based results and next steps. By attending the Designing Educational Ecosystems training, I will “develop the complete suite of skills needed to begin successfully leading [these] short permaculture workshops and other events on [my] own,” which is why I am asking for your support in proactively funding this workshop series.


Awesome Swag.

All swag was produced by yours truly, with the exception of the poem "My Haiti Dream," which was written by my good friend Jean Arnaud. The shirts feature designs I created specifically to fund this course and are original. The syllabus and composition of each course offered will be my own, though greatly inspired by my teachers and mentors. For more photos of "awesome swag" please visit the Gallery tab above.

Note: Please be sure to check out the dates on all of the awesome swag being offered, including the workshops. Because organizing workshops is uncharted territory for me - thankfully, this is what I will learn in the course! - I do need some time to prepare. There is a good chance items will be shipped earlier than their expected dates, and workshops will be offered in the Spring; however, I want to ensure quality over haste, and give all you wonderful people knock-your-socks-off gifts for your generosity.

Ethics of Permaculture T-shirts

If you're interested in supporting this campaign by purchasing a t-shirt, you can find pictures in the Gallery tab above! The shirt designs are still in the drafting process right now, as I receive feedback from community members and friends (please let me know if you have any ideas, as well!). The final designs won't diverge drastically from what you see above, and there will likely be 3-4 shirt options to choose from! If you donate, please be sure to provide your contact information - email will suffice - so I can be in touch as the process unfolds. And, as always, thank you!


Additional Resources.

Introduction to Permaculture: One-day Workshop
Introduction to Permaculture: Two-day Workshop
Living Permaculture: Introduction to the practice, ethics, and principles
(What you will help make happen.)

My Biography
(Why you should trust me to run these workshops.)

Designing Educational Ecosystems: Workshop Description
(The training that will propel me into permaculture teacherdom.)

Designing Educational Ecosystems: Student Outcomes and Testimonials
(Some more on what I will take away from the teacher training in March.)

Community Supported Education
(A description of the CSE model, and how it can enable young teachers to do awesome things.)

Cost Breakdown
(Where your money is going.)

"My Haiti Dream"
(Observations & thoughts from my recent trip to Haiti.)

story: The I.D.E.A.L. Reading Foundation - Ideas Dan a los Estudiantes para Apoyar a su Lectura, a not-for-profit,501 (c)3, corporation, headquartered in New York - was founded by Ian Hynes when he was a senior at the Gow School in South Wales, NY. Ian a student with severe dyslexia, knew first hand how hard school can be for students like himself. Ian who firmly believed he would be a drop out if his family hadn't placed him at the Gow School wanted to find a way to give other kids the same advantage he had.Today Ian's I.D.E.A.L. is actively, raising funds to help our partner schools identify dyslexics and find ways to teach them successfully by providing support especially in the area of technology to those students who do not have the resources Ian had.

story:
WE'RE THE LAST ONE STANDING!
You may have heard about the new movie Dallas Buyers Club starring Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, but did you know that there is only one remaining buyers' club in the United States? The New York Buyers' Club used to serve alongside other Buyers' Clubs like those in Boston and Houston. NYBC is the only one left--but we are still here! We are a member-operated and supported non-profit co-op.

We provide life-sustaining supplements and evidenced-based health information for people with HIV, hepatitis and other chronic conditions. Complementary and alternative therapies, ranging from antioxidants to herbs, are vital options too often overlooked in today's prescription-happy society, but well documented on our website. If NYBC disappears, decades of accumulated knowledge may disappear as well.

HELP US FIGHT THE GOOD FIGHT!
We urgently need your help to raise $10,000 by December 1, 2013. With your help, we can reach our goal. Our mission is to provide education and outreach about not just living but thriving with chronic disease. With HIV, managing antiretroviral (ARV) side effects can be challenging. In the short term, they can cause diarrhea, nausea, psychiatric effects and harm the liver. Over the longer term, they damage bones and kidneys, increase blood lipids, alter body fat composition, increase heart attack risk, cause peripheral nerve damage and a host of other problems. Other illnesses present similar challenges. How can people survive and thrive? Our members know that many of these supplements can mitigate many of these symptoms.

EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS ABOUT WELLNESS AND SUPPORT
This past March, you may have attended or heard about one of our events, “HIV & Aging: Living Long and Well” with Steve Karpiak, Ph.D., which offered many eye-opening perspectives on the challenges faced by the growing population of HIV+ people over 50. Your support will help us to hold a follow-up event as well as future events for 2014. Funds are needed to help us to:

  • Resume publication of our SUPPLEMENT newsletter
  • Redouble our efforts in posting to our blog, which summarizes scientific studies in plain language
  • Prepare more frequent Tweets, Facebook and other public media
  • Continue the research and review of data and journal articles
EMPOWERMENT THROUGH KNOWLEDGE
NYBC is committed to an evidence-based approach to treatment. This work requires a great deal of research covering a wide array of topics. We share with you that evidence on the benefits, limitations and potential problems of the supplements may confer. The information NYBC strives to provide is designed to help people make INFORMED decisions about whether to use or not use any particular supplement. Our bottom line is working to provide a longer, healthier life, despite not just HIV, but other diseases like hepatitis C. Most of us are people LIVING with these infections ourselves!

You can read the feature article about NYBC in the April 24, 2013 issue of Gay City News: “HIV+ Wellness Can Be a Cooperative Push.” The article discusses the crucial role of a non-profit co-op like NYBC in helping people survive and thrive through the AIDS epidemic.

PLEASE MAKE A CONTRIBUTION TODAY!
Remember, your contribution to NYBC is tax-deductible because we are a 501c3 nonprofit. We are the ONLY remaining buyers’ club for people with HIV/AIDS in the USA. Thank you for your donation to keep us going and growing.

From all of us at The New York Buyers’ Club - Thank You!



(NB: NYBC is unaffiliated with Dallas Buyers Club, the movie, its producers, affiliates or cast, though we saw a preview and quite liked it the memories it evoked of that era--that is STILL just as turbulent and terrifying for millions the world over.)
